sentence.Network_cn: 接着，合上双眼，然后再用力闭紧。

sentence.Network_en: Screw down the lid fairly tightly.

phrase.cizu_name: have one's head screwed on (the right way)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)exert strong psychological pressure on (someone) so as to intimidate them into doing something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)给（某人）施加心理压力；强迫（某人）

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)an additional degree of pressure or hardship added to a situation that is already extremely difficult to bear
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)困难情况下又添加的压力；雪上加霜

phrase.cizu_name: turn (或 tighten) the screw (或 screws)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)treat someone unfairly; cheat or swindle someone
(informal)cause someone to be emotionally or mentally disturbed

lj.lj_ly: this job can really screw you up.
lj.lj_ls: 这份工作真能使你精神紧张。

jx.jx_en_mean: crush a piece of paper or fabric into a tight mass
(informal)cause something to fail or go wrong

lj.lj_ly: why are you trying to screw up your life?.
lj.lj_ls: 你为什么要把生活搞得一团糟？。

lj.lj_ly: now Stephen had to screw up his courage and confess.
lj.lj_ls: 现在斯蒂芬不得不鼓起勇气承认。

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To act or fool around aimlessly or in a confused way and accomplish nothing.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 虚度：无目的地或以糊涂的方式行动或干傻事，什么也没有完成

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Slang} To make a mess of (an undertaking).

lj.lj_ly: Lifting those boxes really screwed up my back.
lj.lj_ls: 抬这些箱确实令我的背部受到损伤

jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【俚语】} 使心情烦乱或紧张

jx.jx_en_mean: To behave in an eccentric manner.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun): from Old French escroue 'female screw, nut', from Latin scrofa, literally 'sow', later 'screw'. The early sense of the verb was 'contort (the features), twist around' (late 16th cent.)

entry.def: A screw is a metal object similar to a nail, with a raised spiral line around it. You turn a screw using a screwdriver so that it goes through two things, for example two pieces of wood, and fastens them together.

example.ex: Each bracket is fixed to the wall with just three screws.
example.tran: 每个托架只用了 3 颗螺钉固定在墙上。

entry.def: If you screw something somewhere or if it screws somewhere, you fix it in place by means of a screw or screws.

example.ex: I had screwed the shelf on the wall myself...
example.tran: 我自己用螺钉把架子固定在墙上。
用螺钉固定住所有松动的地板。

entry.def: A screw lid or fitting is one that has a raised spiral line on the inside or outside of it, so that it can be fixed in place by twisting.

example.ex: ...an ordinary jam jar with a screw lid.
example.tran: 带螺旋盖的普通果酱罐

entry.def: If you screw something somewhere or if it screws somewhere, you fix it in place by twisting it round and round.

example.ex: Kelly screwed the silencer onto the pistol...
example.tran: 凯利把消音器拧到手枪上。

example.ex: Screw down the lid fairly tightly...

entry.tran: 把(纸等)揉成一团，拧成一团
entry.def: If you screw something such as a piece of paper into a ball, you squeeze it or twist it tightly so that it is in the shape of a ball.

example.ex: He screwed the paper into a ball and tossed it into the fire.
example.tran: 他把纸揉成一团抛进火里。

entry.def: If you screw your face or your eyes into a particular expression, you tighten the muscles of your face to form that expression, for example because you are in pain or because the light is too bright.

example.ex: He screwed his face into an expression of mock pain.

entry.def: If someone screws someone else or if two people screw, they have sex together.
Some people use screw in expressions such as screw you or screw that to show that they are not concerned about someone or something or that they feel contempt for them.
If someone says that they have been screwed, they mean that someone else has cheated them, especially by getting money from them dishonestly.

example.ex: They haven't given us accurate information. We've been screwed...
example.tran: 他们没有提供准确的消息。我们被骗了。

example.ex: The consumer is getting screwed by cover charges as well.
example.tran: 这名消费者也被诈取了服务费。

entry.def: If someone screws something, especially money, out of you, they get it from you by putting pressure on you.

example.ex: For decades rich nations have been screwing money out of poor nations.
example.tran: 富国压榨穷国长达数十载。

entry.def: Prisoners often refer to prison officers as screws .
A screw is a propeller on a ship or an aircraft.
If you turn or tighten the screw on someone, you increase the pressure which is already on them, for example by using threats, in order to force them to do a particular thing.

example.ex: Parisian taxi drivers are threatening to mount a blockade to turn the screw on the government.
example.tran: 巴黎出租车司机们正威胁阻塞交通以对政府进一步施压。

entry.tran: 愈逼愈紧的压力(或行动)
entry.def: You can refer to each of a series of threats or actions which are intended to force someone to do a particular thing as another turn of the screw .

example.ex: Every rebel raid is another turn of the screw, increasing the pressure on the President.
example.tran: 每次叛乱分子发动袭击就是又往前逼进了一步，使得总统的压力越来越大。

means.word_mean: 2. a simple machine of the inclined-plane type consisting of a spirally threaded cylindrical rod that engages with a similarly threaded hole
3. a propeller with several angled blades that rotates to push against water or air
4. a fastener with a tapered threaded shank and a slotted head

sentences.sentence: "This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm"
"Were you ever intimate with this man?"

means.word_mean: 3. cause to penetrate, as with a circular motion;
4. tighten or fasten by means of screwing motions;
5. defeat someone in an expectation through trickery or deceit

example.en: We had better quit screwing the pooch and get cracking.
example.zh: 我们最好快点干，别再浪费时间了。

example.en: That salesman tried to screw me, but I just walked out on him.
example.zh: 那个推销员本来想让我上当，可是我不理他，走开了。

example.en: Screw carefully before you cross the street.
example.zh: 过马路前仔细看清来往车辆。

example.en: He's telling everybody that he screwed her.
example.zh: 他在告诉大家,他跟她上过床了。

auth_sentence.content: That would just allow people to screw things up.
auth_sentence.res_content: That would just allow people to screw things up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That would just allow people to screw things up.

auth_sentence.content: That would kind of screw up any future investigations.
auth_sentence.res_content: That would kind of screw up any future investigations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That would kind of screw up any future investigations.

auth_sentence.content: So, pardon the phrase, but un-screw CFL's!
auth_sentence.res_content: So, pardon the phrase, but un-screw CFL's!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So, pardon the phrase, but un-screw CFL's!

sentences.en: The handle of this door is kept by two screws.
sentences.cn: 这扇门的把手用两枚螺丝钉固定。

sentences.en: Squeaking floorboards should be screwed down.
sentences.cn: 踏上去咯咯作响的地板应用螺钉钉住。

sentences.en: The table legs are screwed to the floor.
sentences.cn: 桌子腿用螺钉固定在地板上。

sentences.en: The two pieces screw together easily.
sentences.cn: 这两个部件很容易拧紧。

sentences.en: Let's screw the two pipes together end to end.
sentences.cn: 咱们把这两根管子接起来拧紧。

jushi.english: The handle of this door is kept by two screws.
jushi.chinese: 这扇门的把手用两枚螺丝钉固定。

jushi.english: I removed the last of the screws and took the back off the machine.
jushi.chinese: 我旋下最后一颗螺丝钉,打开了机器的后盖。

jushi.english: The two pieces screw together easily.
jushi.chinese: 这两个部件很容易拧紧。
